meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a nun.
meanings.sent1: Her quiet and modest attire gave her a nunnish appearance.
meanings.sent2: The convent garden had a peaceful, nunnish atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her love for early bedtime was quite nunnish.
meanings.sent4: The old library had a nunnish stillness, untouched by time.
meanings.sent5: The nunnish silence of the chapel enveloped her in tranquility.

meanings.definition: Behaving or living like a nun.
meanings.sent1: His dedication to charity work was truly nunnish.
meanings.sent2: The simple life of the hermit was nunnish in nature.
meanings.sent3: She found his strict schedule oddly nunnish but endearing.
meanings.sent4: The nunnish routine of prayer and meditation brought her peace.
meanings.sent5: Her commitment to helping others mirrored a nunnish devotion.
